Class CelestialBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • Point
      • CelestialBody
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Asteroid, Moon, Planet, Star

    public abstract class CelestialBody
extends Point
    This class represents a CelestialBody, a subclass of Point. This can be subclassed to represent any object in space.
    See Also:
    Point

    • Constructor Detail

      • CelestialBody

        public CelestialBody(CelestialBody[] system,
                     DBReader database,
                     int id)
        Constructor method for creating a new CelestialBody using a database.
        Parameters:
        system - The solar system that the CelestialBody belongs to
        database - The database that hold information about the CelestialBody
        id - The unique ID of the CelestialBody

      • CelestialBody

        public CelestialBody(double diameter,
                     double distance,
                     double velocity,
                     java.lang.String colour,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     Point orbiting)
        Constructor method for making a new CelestialBody.
        Parameters:
        diameter - The diameter of the CelestialBody
        distance - The distance between the CelestialBody and whatever it is orbiting
        velocity - The speed the CelestialBody is travelling at
        colour - The colour of the CelestialBody
        name - The unique name of the CelestialBody
        orbiting - The Point the CelestialBody is orbiting

    • Method Detail

      • sharedConstructor

        public void sharedConstructor()
        A method that contains code shared by both constructors. The purpose of this is to: - Adjust the distance of the orbiting object to outside the radius of the object it is orbiting - Set the angle to a random point in space - Confirm in the console that the object has been made

      • move

        public void move(SystemSimulation mySystem)
        Method that moves the CelestialBody through space. The method varies depending on whether the object moves or not.
        Parameters:
        mySystem - The solar system that the object belongs to
